metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1836 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in the xmlDictComputeFastKey function in libxml2 before 2.9.4, as used in Apple iOS before 9.3.2, OS X before 10.11.5, tvOS before 9.2.1, and watchOS before 2.2.1, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service via a crafted XML document.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1836` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxml2 - 2.9.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu4.8
libxml2-utils - 2.9.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu4.8
python-libxml2 - 2.9.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu4.8
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> 2.9.2 first introduced the flaw but it was backported to Trusty via 0006-Fix-a-parsing-bug-on-non-ascii-element-and-CR-LF-usa.patch

criterions.comment: libxml2 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.9.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu4.8').
